meanings.definition: Characterized by the breaking of a chemical bond in such a way that one of the atoms retains both electrons from the bond.
meanings.sent1: The chemist observed a heterolytic reaction in the lab.
meanings.sent2: The heterolytic cleavage of the molecule led to the formation of new compounds.
meanings.sent3: The heterolytic breakup of the bond was like a magic trick in the experiment.
meanings.sent4: The heterolytic process was akin to a one-sided partnership in chemistry.
meanings.sent5: The heterolytic event left a lasting impression on the researchers.

meanings.definition: Involving the unequal sharing of electrons in a chemical bond.
meanings.sent1: The scientist explained the concept of heterolytic bonding to the students.
meanings.sent2: The molecule exhibited heterolytic behavior due to the unequal electron distribution.
meanings.sent3: The heterolytic electron dance in the bond was like a seesaw game.
meanings.sent4: The heterolytic connection between the atoms was like a lopsided friendship.
meanings.sent5: The heterolytic interaction was vividly illustrated in the model.
